trans-unit.source: Plans and Billing in Azure Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Plans and Billing in Azure Scheduler

trans-unit.source: Plans and Billing in Azure Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Plans and Billing in Azure Scheduler

trans-unit.source: Job Collection Plans
trans-unit.target: Job Collection Plans

trans-unit.source: Job collections are the billable entity in Azure Scheduler.
trans-unit.target: Job collections are the billable entity in Azure Scheduler.

trans-unit.source: Job collections contain a number of jobs and come in three plans – Free, Standard, and Premium – that are described below.
trans-unit.target: Job collections contain a number of jobs and come in three plans – Free, Standard, and Premium – that are described below.

trans-unit.source: Job Collection Plan
trans-unit.target: Job Collection Plan

trans-unit.source: Max # of Jobs per Job Collection
trans-unit.target: Max # of Jobs per Job Collection

trans-unit.source: Max Recurrence
trans-unit.target: Max Recurrence

trans-unit.source: Max Job Collections per Subscription
trans-unit.target: Max Job Collections per Subscription

trans-unit.source: Limits
trans-unit.target: Limits

trans-unit.source: Free
trans-unit.target: Free

trans-unit.source: 5 jobs per job collection
trans-unit.target: 5 jobs per job collection

trans-unit.source: Once per hour.
trans-unit.target: Once per hour.

trans-unit.source: Cannot execute jobs more often than once an hour
trans-unit.target: Cannot execute jobs more often than once an hour

trans-unit.source: A subscription is allowed up to 1 free job collection
trans-unit.target: A subscription is allowed up to 1 free job collection

trans-unit.source: Cannot use [HTTP outbound authorization object](scheduler-outbound-authentication.md)
trans-unit.target: Cannot use [HTTP outbound authorization object](scheduler-outbound-authentication.md)

trans-unit.source: Standard
trans-unit.target: Standard

trans-unit.source: 50 jobs per job collection
trans-unit.target: 50 jobs per job collection

trans-unit.source: Once per minute.
trans-unit.target: Once per minute.

trans-unit.source: Cannot execute jobs more often than once a minute
trans-unit.target: Cannot execute jobs more often than once a minute

trans-unit.source: A subscription is allowed up to 100 standard job collections
trans-unit.target: A subscription is allowed up to 100 standard job collections

trans-unit.source: Access to full feature set of Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Access to full feature set of Scheduler

trans-unit.source: Premium
trans-unit.target: Premium

trans-unit.source: 50 jobs per job collection
trans-unit.target: 50 jobs per job collection

trans-unit.source: Once per minute.
trans-unit.target: Once per minute.

trans-unit.source: Cannot execute jobs more often than once a minute
trans-unit.target: Cannot execute jobs more often than once a minute

trans-unit.source: A subscription is allowed up to 10,000 premium job collections.
trans-unit.target: A subscription is allowed up to 10,000 premium job collections.

trans-unit.source: Contact us for more.
trans-unit.target: Contact us for more.

trans-unit.source: Access to full feature set of Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Access to full feature set of Scheduler

trans-unit.source: Upgrades and Downgrades of Job Collection Plans
trans-unit.target: Upgrades and Downgrades of Job Collection Plans

trans-unit.source: You may upgrade or downgrade a job collection plan anytime among the Free, Standard, and Premium plans.
trans-unit.target: You may upgrade or downgrade a job collection plan anytime among the Free, Standard, and Premium plans.

trans-unit.source: However, when downgrading to a free job collection, the downgrade may fail for one of the following reasons:
trans-unit.target: However, when downgrading to a free job collection, the downgrade may fail for one of the following reasons:

trans-unit.source: A free job collection already exists in the subscription
trans-unit.target: A free job collection already exists in the subscription

trans-unit.source: A job in the job collection has a higher recurrence than allowed for jobs in free job collections.
trans-unit.target: A job in the job collection has a higher recurrence than allowed for jobs in free job collections.

trans-unit.source: The maximum recurrence allowed in a free job collection is once per hour
trans-unit.target: The maximum recurrence allowed in a free job collection is once per hour

trans-unit.source: There are more than 5 jobs in the job collection
trans-unit.target: There are more than 5 jobs in the job collection

trans-unit.source: A job in the job collection has an HTTP or HTTPS action that uses an [HTTP outbound authorization object](scheduler-outbound-authentication.md)
trans-unit.target: A job in the job collection has an HTTP or HTTPS action that uses an [HTTP outbound authorization object](scheduler-outbound-authentication.md)

trans-unit.source: Billing and Azure Plans
trans-unit.target: Billing and Azure Plans

trans-unit.source: Subscriptions are not charged for free job collections.
trans-unit.target: Subscriptions are not charged for free job collections.

trans-unit.source: If you have more than 100 standard job collections (10 standard billing units), then it's a better deal to have all job collections in the premium plan.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than 100 standard job collections (10 standard billing units), then it's a better deal to have all job collections in the premium plan.

trans-unit.source: If you have one standard job collection and one premium job collection, you are billed one standard billing unit _and_ one premium billing unit.
trans-unit.target: If you have one standard job collection and one premium job collection, you are billed one standard billing unit _and_ one premium billing unit.

trans-unit.source: The Scheduler service bills based on the number of active job collections that are set to either standard or premium; this is explained further in the next two sections.
trans-unit.target: The Scheduler service bills based on the number of active job collections that are set to either standard or premium; this is explained further in the next two sections.

trans-unit.source: Standard Billable Units
trans-unit.target: Standard Billable Units

trans-unit.source: A standard billable unit can include up to 10 standard job collections.
trans-unit.target: A standard billable unit can include up to 10 standard job collections.

trans-unit.source: Since a standard job collection can have up to 50 jobs per job collection, one standard billing unit allows a subscription to have up to 500 jobs – up to almost 22 million job executions per month.
trans-unit.target: Since a standard job collection can have up to 50 jobs per job collection, one standard billing unit allows a subscription to have up to 500 jobs – up to almost 22 million job executions per month.

trans-unit.source: If you have between 1 and 10 standard job collections, you'll be billed for 1 standard billing unit.
trans-unit.target: If you have between 1 and 10 standard job collections, you'll be billed for 1 standard billing unit.

trans-unit.source: If you have between 11 and 20 standard job collections, you'll be billed for 2 standard billing units.
trans-unit.target: If you have between 11 and 20 standard job collections, you'll be billed for 2 standard billing units.

trans-unit.source: If you have between 21 and 30 standard job collections, you'll be billed for 3 standard billing units, and so on.
trans-unit.target: If you have between 21 and 30 standard job collections, you'll be billed for 3 standard billing units, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Premium Billable Units
trans-unit.target: Premium Billable Units

trans-unit.source: A premium billable unit can include up to 10,000 premium job collections.
trans-unit.target: A premium billable unit can include up to 10,000 premium job collections.

trans-unit.source: Since a premium job collection can have up to 50 jobs per job collection, one premium billing unit allows a subscription to have up to 500,000 jobs – up to almost 22 billion job executions per month.
trans-unit.target: Since a premium job collection can have up to 50 jobs per job collection, one premium billing unit allows a subscription to have up to 500,000 jobs – up to almost 22 billion job executions per month.

trans-unit.source: If you have between 1 and 10,000 premium job collections, you'll be billed for 1 premium billing unit.
trans-unit.target: If you have between 1 and 10,000 premium job collections, you'll be billed for 1 premium billing unit.

trans-unit.source: If you have between 10,001 and 20,000 premium job collections, you'll be billed for 2 premium billing units, and so on.
trans-unit.target: If you have between 10,001 and 20,000 premium job collections, you'll be billed for 2 premium billing units, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Thus, premium job collections have the same functionality as the standard job collections but provide a price break in case your application requires a lot of job collections.
trans-unit.target: Thus, premium job collections have the same functionality as the standard job collections but provide a price break in case your application requires a lot of job collections.

trans-unit.source: Billing and Active Status
trans-unit.target: Billing and Active Status

trans-unit.source: Job collections are always active unless your entire subscription has gone into some temporary disabled state due to billing issues.
trans-unit.target: Job collections are always active unless your entire subscription has gone into some temporary disabled state due to billing issues.

trans-unit.source: The only way to ensure that a job collection is not billed is to either set it to the _Free_ plan or to delete the job collection.
trans-unit.target: The only way to ensure that a job collection is not billed is to either set it to the _Free_ plan or to delete the job collection.

trans-unit.source: Although you may disable all jobs within a job collection in a single operation, it does not change the billing status of the job collection – the job collection will _still_ be billed.
trans-unit.target: Although you may disable all jobs within a job collection in a single operation, it does not change the billing status of the job collection – the job collection will _still_ be billed.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, empty job collections are considered active and will be billed.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, empty job collections are considered active and will be billed.

trans-unit.source: Pricing
trans-unit.target: Pricing

trans-unit.source: For pricing details, please see [Scheduler Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/scheduler/).
trans-unit.target: For pricing details, please see [Scheduler Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/scheduler/).
